ASO Titer: Level of antibodies against streptolysin O, used to show recent streptococcal (strep) infection
Anti-TPO: Antibodies against thyroid peroxidase, used to detect autoimmune thyroid disease
Anti-Tg: Antibodies against thyroglobulin, used to assess autoimmune thyroid disorders
Bicarbonate: Level of bicarbonate (HCOâ‚ƒ-) in blood, helping maintain the bodyâ€™s acidâ€“base (pH) balance
C-Peptide: Protein fragment released when the body makes insulin, used to assess insulin production
Copper in Plasma: Level of copper circulating in the liquid part of the blood
Direct Bilirubin: Conjugated (water-soluble) bilirubin processed by the liver
Eosinophils count: White cells active in allergy response
Estrogen: Main female sex hormone that helps regulate menstrual cycle and reproductive organs
FBS: Fasting blood sugar level measured after no calorie intake for several hours
Fructosamine: Measurement of glycated proteins reflecting average blood sugar over the past 2â€“3 weeks
Gamma Glutamyl Transferase (GGT): Indicator of liver or bile duct issues
Hematocrit: Proportion of red blood cells in blood
Hemoglobin: Oxygen-carrying protein in red blood cells
Indirect Bilirubin: Unconjugated bilirubin formed from breakdown of red blood cells before liver processing
MCH: Average amount of hemoglobin per red cell
MCHC: Concentration of hemoglobin in red cells
MCV: Average size of red blood cells
Prolactin: Hormone from the pituitary gland that helps control breast development and milk production
RBS: Random blood sugar level measured at any time of the day
RDW: Variation in size of red blood cells
Reticulocyte Count: Number of young (immature) red blood cells being produced in the bone marrow
Rheumatoid Factor: Antibody measured in blood that helps detect rheumatoid arthritis and some other autoimmune diseases
T3: Thyroid hormone that helps control bodyâ€™s metabolism and energy use
T4: Main thyroid hormone released by the thyroid gland that regulates metabolism
Total Bilirubin: Total amount of bilirubin in blood from red blood cell breakdown and liver processing
Transferrin: Main blood protein that binds and transports iron
Uric Acid: Uric acid level, related to gout
Vitamin A: Fat-soluble vitamin important for vision, immune function, and healthy skin and mucous membranes
Vitamin B1: Thiamine; B vitamin that helps the body convert food into energy and supports nerve and heart function
Vitamin B12: Vitamin important for red cells and nerves
Vitamin B2: Riboflavin; B vitamin involved in energy production and maintaining healthy skin and eyes
Vitamin B3: Niacin; B vitamin that supports energy production, cholesterol control, and healthy skin and nerves
Vitamin B5: Pantothenic acid; B vitamin needed to make and break down fats and hormones
Vitamin B6: Pyridoxine; B vitamin important for protein metabolism, brain function, and making red blood cells
Vitamin B7: Biotin; B vitamin that supports metabolism of fats and carbohydrates and helps maintain healthy hair, skin, and nails
Vitamin B9: Folate/folic acid, B vitamin needed for DNA synthesis and healthy red blood cell formation
Vitamin C: Water-soluble vitamin that acts as an antioxidant and supports immunity, wound healing, and collagen formation
Vitamin D (25 OH): Vitamin D for bone and immune health
Vitamin E: Fat-soluble antioxidant vitamin that protects cells from damage and supports immune function
Vitamin K1: Fat-soluble vitamin mainly involved in normal blood clotting
Zinc in Plasma: Level of zinc circulating in the liquid part of the blood
